Stem: Hairy, especially when young. Dark green to brownish-green, branched.
Leaves: Egg to oval-shaped with pointed tips, 5-10 cm long, hairy and with prominent veins.
Flowers: Bright yellow 2-4 cm across, singular in fork of upper leaves, usually 4 petals but sometimes 5 or 6. Only last single day.
FruitSeeds: Reddish-brown capsule 10-25 mm long containing thousands of seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from *Ludwigia peploides ssp. montividensis* by smaller leaf stalks, and from *Ludwigia longifolia* by being hairy.
